intro: Gossypium drynarioides, commonly known as the African cotton tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces fluffy, cotton-like fibers within its seed pods. Gossypium drynarioides is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils.
